remarks: A finite product of non-zero terms is non-zero.  A version of ~ fprodn0 using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
statement:
fprodn0f.kph $e |- F/ k ph $.
fprodn0f.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fprodn0f.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B e. CC ) $.
fprodn0f.bne0 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B =/= 0 ) $.
fprodn0f $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. A B =/= 0 ) $.
$d A k $.
